en: View all posts in the %category_name category
There are too many datasets to show on the chart. Not all will be shown until you remove some selections.

This table includes additional information to the above visualized indicators, i.e. a short definition of this indicator and a description of the politically determined target values as well as explaining the political intention behind selecting this indicator.
This table provides information on metadata for SDG indicators as defined by the UN Statistical Commission. Complete global metadata is provided by the UN Statistics Division.

The synoptic table provides information about the evaluation of an indicator in previous years. It shows if the weather symbol assigned to an indicator was rather stable or volatile in the past years.
Click on the legend to remove individual lines from the chart.

This table provides metadata for the actual indicator available from %country_adjective statistics closest to the corresponding global SDG indicator. Please note that even when the SDG indicator is fully available from %country_adjective statistics, this table should be consulted for information on national methodology and other country specific metadata information.

Choose categories from the dropdowns below to see different breakdowns of the data. Some will not be available until a higher level is chosen.
Select here what should be displayed in the chart and in the table.
This is a development website. We welcome your feedback.
Target and intention <small>(Text from the Indicator Report 2018)</small>
Link to the global metadata of this indicator
UN designated tier
The indicator is not moving in the right direction so that the gap to the target value is widening
If the trend continues, the indicator will be presumably miss its target by at least 5 % and at most 20&nbsp% of the difference between the target value and the current value
If the trend continues, the target value will be met or the difference between the target value and the current value will be less than 5 %
The indicator is moving in the right direction but if the trend continues, the target value will be missed by more than 20 % in the target year

percentage of persons who are materially deprived should stay below the level within the european union
percentage of persons who are severely materially deprived should stay below the level within the european union
increase the proportion of foreign school leavers with a least a secondary general school certificate by 2030
bring their proportion into line with that of german school graduates by 2030
gini coefficient of income after social transfers to be below the eu-28 average by 2030
11.1.a - expansion of settlement and transport area
limit to 30 ha minus x per day by 2030
reduce the loss of per capita open space area
no decrease in the density of settlements
11.2.a - final energy consumption in goods transport
11.2.b - final energy consumption in passenger transport
11.2.c - accessibility of medium-sized and large cities by public transport
reduce the average travel time by public transport
reduce the proportion of people who overburdened to 13 % by 2030
12.1.a - market share of products certified by publicly managed eco-labelling schemes
12.1.b - energy consumption and co<sub>2</sub> emissions from consumption
reduce by at least 40 % by 2020, by at least 55 % by 2030, by at least 70 % by 2040 and by 80 to 95 % by 2050 – in each case compared with 1990
13.1.b - international climate finance for the reduction of greenhouse gases and adaptation to climate change
14.1.aa - nitrogen input to the north sea through german inflows
maintain a good quality in accordance with the ordinance on the protection of surface waters (keep annual averages of total nitrogen below 2.8 milligrams per litre)
14.1.ab - nitrogen input to the baltic sea through german inflows
maintain a good quality in accordance with the ordinance on the protection of surface waters (keep annual averages of total nitrogen below 2.6 milligrams per litre)
14.1.b - proportion of sustainably fished stocks of fish in the north and the baltic sea
manage sustainably all fish stocks used for economic purposes in accordance with the msy approach by 2020
increase to an index value of 100 by 2030
reduce the proportion by 35 % compared with 2005
15.3 - preservation or restoration of forests in developing countries under the redd+ rulebook
reduce the number of criminal offences recorded per 100,000 inhabitants to less than 7,000 by 2030
16.2 - number of projects to secure, register and destroy small arms and light weapons carried out by germany in affected regions of the world
by 2030 at least 15 projects each year
17.1 - expenditure for official development assistance as a proportion of gross national income
increase the proportion to 0.7 % of gni by 2030
17.2 - number of students and researchers from developing countries and ldcs per year
17.3 - imports from the least developed countries (lcds)
increase the proportion by 100 % by 2030 (base year: 2014)
on an annual average for the period 2028 to 2032, a reduction of the nitrogen surpluses of the overall balance for germany to 70 kilograms per hectare of utilised agricultural area
share of organic farming on land used for agriculture to be increased to 20 % by 2030
2.2 - support for good governance in attaining appropriate nutrition globally

adequate increase of the share of disbursments used for implementating of guidelines and recommendations made by the un  good governance for food security by 2030. angemessene steigerung des anteils der ausgezahlten mittel für die anwendung von leitlinien und empfehlungen des vn-welternährungsausschusses an den gesamtausgaben für ernährungssicherung bis 2030
reduce the premature mortality to 100 deaths per 100,000 female inhabitants by 2030
reduce the premature mortality to 190 deaths per 100,000 male inhabitants by 2030
further increase is to be permanently stopped.
3.1.f - share of adults suffering from obesity
further increase is to be permanently stopped.
reduce emissions to 55 % of the 2005 value by 2030
3.2.b - share of the population with excessive exposure to pm<sub>10</sub> in germany
who particulate matter guideline value of 20 micrograms/ cubic metre for pm<sub>10</sub> to be adhered to as widely as possible by 2030
reduce the proportion to below 10 % by 2020
4.1.b - 30- bis 34-jährige mit tertiärem oder postsekundarem nicht-tertiären abschluss
4.2.a - children in institutional all-day care (0 to 2-year-olds)
4.2.b - children in institutional all-day care (3 to 5-year-olds)
increase the proportion to 60 % by 2020 and 70 % by 2030
reduce the gap to 10 % by 2020, maintain that proportion up to 2030
5.1.b - women in management positions in business
30 % women in supervisory boards of listed and fully co-determined companies by 2030
5.1.c - vocational qualification of women and girls through german development assistance
increase gradually by one third by 2030 compared with base year 2015
not exceeding benchmark values for specific types of water bodies at all monitoring points by 2030
not exceeding the threshold value of 50 mg/l of nitrate in groundwater by 2030
6.2 - development cooperation for drinking water and sanitation
give 10 million people access to water each year till 2030
increase energy productivity by 2.1 % per year from 2008 to 2050
reduce consumption by 20 % by 2020 and by 50 % by 2050 compared with 2008
7.2.a - share of renewable energies in gross final energy consumption
increase the proportion to 18 % by 2020, to 30 % by 2030 and to 60 % by 2050
7.2.b - share of electricity from renewable energy sources in electricity consumption
increase the proportion to at least 35 % by 2020, to at least 50 % by 2030 and to at least 80 % by 2050
trend of the years 2000 – 2010 to be continued up to 2030
annual government deficit less than 3 % of gdp, to be continued up to 2030
structurally balanced government budget, general government structural deficit must not exceed 0.5 % of gdp, to be continued up to 2030
ratio of government debt to gdp must not exceed 60 %, to be continued up to 2030
8.3 - gross fixed capital formation in relation to gdp
appropriate development of the ratio, to be continued up to 2030
8.6 - number of members of the textiles partnership
9.1 - private and public expenditure on research and development
at least 3.5 % of gdp per year by 2025
Status summary - Evaluation in previous years
Improving educational success of foreigners in German schools
Making consumption environmentally and socially compatible
Increasing the proportion of sustainable production
Realising the exemplary role of the public sector in sustainable procurement
Reducing greenhouse gases and contributing to international climate financing
Protecting and sustainably using oceans and marine resources
Protecting ecosystems, conserving ecosystem services and preserving habitats
Taking practical action to combat proliferation, especially of small arms
Improving trade opportunities for developing countries
Environmentally sound production in our cultivated landscapes
Realising globally the right to food
Continuously improving education and vocational training
Improving the compatibility of work and family life
Promoting equal opportunities in society and strengthening the economic participation of women globally
Reducing the pollution of water with substances
Better access to drinking water and sanitation worldwide, higher (safer) quality
Consolidating public finances - Creating intergenerational equity
Creating favourable investment conditions - Securing long-term prosperity
Combining larger economic output with environmental and social responsibility
Shaping the future with new solutions
Knowledge transfer, espaecially in technical areas
